name: diode production, glass-, for surface-mounting | diode, glass-, for surface-mounting | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/5034/documentation

This dataset represents the production of 1 kg of a typical SMD type diode for surface mounting. It is based on the assumption that a typical SMD diode in electronic modules has an average weight of 32 mg. The data represent a typical SMD type diode for surface mounting used in the information and communication technology. Material data are taken from datasheets of producers of such diodes and from the literature. Infrastructure and production efforts are based on own assumptions. The production efforts represent not a specific diode type and have thus, accordingly higher uncertainties.;[This dataset was already contained in the ecoinvent database version 2. It was not individually updated during the transfer to ecoinvent version 3. Life Cycle Impact Assessment results may still have changed, as they are affected by changes in the supply chain, i.e. in other datasets. This dataset was generated following the ecoinvent quality guidelines for version 2. It may have been subject to central changes described in the ecoinvent version 3 change report (http://www.ecoinvent.org/database/ecoinvent-version-3/reports-of-changes/), and the results of the central updates were reviewed extensively. The changes added e.g. consistent water flows and other information throughout the database. The documentation of this dataset can be found in the ecoinvent reports of version 2, which are still available via the ecoinvent website. The change report linked above covers all central changes that were made during the conversion process.]

From reception of metals and plastics at the factory gate.

This dataset includes raw material input and production efforts for the production of currently used SMD diodes for surface mounting technology.
category: C:Manufacturing/26:Manufacture of computer, electronic and optical products/261:Manufacture of electronic components and boards/2610:Manufacture of electronic components and boards

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Data represent a global valuable composition of SMD type diodes.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: average production composed of the diode wafer production (cleaing, masking, etching, doping, oxidising, metal deposition) and the final assembly of the diode (wafer sawing, die bonding, moulding, trimming and forming)

exchanges.description:
A diode is “a component that restricts the direction of movement of charge carriers. Essentially, it allows an electric current to flow in one direction, but blocks it in the opposite direction.” 
Hence, a diode can be seen as an electronic version of a check valve. A circuit that requires current flow in only one direction will consequently include at least one diode in its circuit design. Currently most of the diodes are made from traditional semiconductor materials like silicium or germanium.
Currently, there is a huge variety of different types of diodes on the market.
EcoSpold01Location=GLO

flow.name: diode, glass-, for surface-mounting
flow.category: C:Manufacturing/26:Manufacture of computer, electronic and optical products/261:Manufacture of electronic components and boards/2610:Manufacture of electronic components and boards

exchanges.description:
Calculated Value. The production of 1 kg of diodes lead to a waste amount of 0.37 kg - whereof 0.04 kg are calculated to be unused raw materials. Hence, this dataset here has an input of 1.04 kg of raw materials per kg of diode. The split to the different raw materials (metals, plastics) is based on the reported material specifications.

Further references:
Philips Semiconductors (2002) Chemical Content of Semiconductor Devices 2002/2003. Philips Semiconductors, Austin / Zoetermeer / Hong Kong / Tokyo

ST Microelectronics (2004) Chemical Content of Semiconductor Packaging. PDF from <http://www.stmicroelectronics.com/stonline/company/environm/report03/envi03.pdf>.
EcoSpold01Location=GLO
